Title: Police apprehend two notorious armed robbery suspects, recover firearms in Nasarawa
Summary: The Nasarawa State Command of the Nigeria Police Force has apprehended two notorious armed robbery suspects . Kabiru Isah and Monday Bulus had been on the command’s wanted list for their alleged involvement in a series of robbery operations across the country .

Title: Edo postpones school resumption date
Summary: Edo State Government postpones resumption of all public and private schools in Edo Central Senatorial District . The postponement may not be unconnected with rising insecurity in the state .

Title: Awujale: Ruling house slams KWAM1 over protest letter to Abiodun
Summary: Fuji musician Alhaji Wasiu Ayinde, also known as KWAM1, has written a protest letter to Ogun State Governor Dapo Abiodun . The Fusengbuwa Ruling House of Ijebu Land has criticised popular Fuji musician .

Title: Why Katsina govt agreed to release 70 bandits in swap deal – Commissioner
Summary: Katsina State Commissioner for Information, Salisu Bala, has explained why the state government agreed to the release of dozens of detained suspected bandits . Bala said the action was part of a swap deal that followed a peace agreement with repentant repentant bandits .

Title: Ogun police investigates alleged assault case of singer portable while in custody
Summary: Ogun State Police Command has ordered an internal investigation following the emergence of a viral video showing Afrobeats singer Habeeb Okikiola, widely known as Portable, being physically assaulted while in police detention . The footage, which began circulating on Xiphone, began circulating online .

Title: Impeachment: Your action an assault on Tinubu, MOSOP tells Rivers Assembly
Summary: Impeachment: Your action an assault on Tinubu, MOSOP tells Rivers Assembly . "At this time, we need to build an investor-friendly environment, and signs of unending political conflicts are not good for our economy at this time," he said .

Title: Lagos reaffirms provision of more shelters in 2026, tackles abandoned buildings
Summary: Lagos reaffirms commitment to expanding access to housing by providing more shelters for residents across the state in 2026, as part of efforts to bridge the housing deficit .

Title: Marketers resist pressure to reduce petrol price below N739 per litre
Summary: Marketers resist pressure to reduce petrol price below N739 per litre . "We are doing our best to sustain supplies at the filling stations but the costs have to be factored into the prices"

Title: Ugwuanyi lauds Nigerian Army for sustaining security, peace
Summary: Gov. Ugwuanyi made this commendation during the West African Social Activities (WASA) event of the 103 Battalion Nigerian Army at Awkwunanaw Barracks .

Title: Plateau: Jang denies calling for Mutfwang’s resignation over defection
Summary: Senator Jang described the report as misleading and taken out of context . The Plateau Senator described it as 'misleading' in a statement issued by his media consultant, Clinton Garuba .

Title: Okpebholo postpones school resumption in Edo Central
Summary: The Edo State Government has postponed the resumption of all public and private schools in Edo Central Senatorial District . The postponement was to enable the state to address some exigencies to improve the welfare of the pupils . The crisis began on Saturday in Ekpoma, Esan West Local Government Area, when residents staged a

Title: Police debunk reports of fire at Edo station
Summary: The Edo State Police Command has debunked social media reports claiming that a police station was gutted by fire in Ekpoma, describing the reports as false and misleading . In a statement on Monday by its spokesperson, ASP Eno Ikoedem, the command said no police facility or station was affected by fire .

Title: Indonesia to introduce single rice price policy in 2026
Summary: The Coordinating Minister for Food Affairs, Zulkifli Hasan, said Indonesia plans to implement a nationwide single rice price policy starting in 2026 . The policy is aimed at ensuring uniform rice prices across the country, including in eastern Indonesia, with the government providing support for distribution financing .

Title: Army rescues 18 passengers from sea pirates on Cameroon waterways
Summary: Troops of the Nigerian Army’s 13 Brigade have rescued 18 passengers, including two infants, following a boat hijacking incident along the Nigeria–Cameroon waterways . Incident occurred on January 11, 2026, when suspected sea pirates hijacked a passenger boat operating along the Kombo Fishing Port axis within Cameroonian waters . The attackers

Title: Army arrests two suspected gun runners in Taraba
Summary: Troops of the Nigerian Army under Operation Whirl Stroke have arrested two suspected gun runners in Taraba State . The arrests were disclosed in a post shared on Nigerian Army’s official X account on Monday . Both suspects are currently in military custody and will be handed over to relevant authorities for prosecution .
